forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 48. Southeast wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers after 10am. Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South wind 6 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn stretches its fingers over the Bay, Downtown San Francisco wakes to a landscape draped in a soft, muted light, hinting at the presence of high clouds offering a restful, yet slightly obscured view of the day ahead. The cooling night has given way to a quiet chill, holding the air at a comfortable 48 degrees. As the hours crawl towards mid-morning, a whisper of rain may cascade from the clouds, a gentle shower that teeters on the brink of possibility, bringing the promise of freshened earth and invigorated spirits. Winds will accompany this potential, weaving through the streets, nudging temperature down to the mid-fifties as the sun plays hide and seek behind the clouds.

Much of the morning may yield an overcast canvas, with hints of sunlight emerging intermittently, but individuals braving the world outdoors should prepare for the likelihood of wet feet and damp layers. Dressing in lightweight, layered fabrics will be prudent: a warm sweater beneath a water-resistant jacket, paired with sturdy boots, will serve well against the elements. For those who find themselves in the heart of the city, a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero might reveal splashes of life amidst the gray, or one could retreat to a cozy café, indulging in warm brews while watching the gentle dance of droplets on windowpanes. Whether venturing out or seeking refuge indoors, this day offers an inviting whisper of adventure cradled in a cool, damp embrace.
